posts.title: Never Say Never
posts.markdown:
Never is a word I’ve used often and should now realize that I should never say never! Here are some favorite 'nevers' that I have said before:
  • I will NEVER homeschool my children! - I’m now a homeschool mom of 4 years.
  • I will NEVER (fill in the blank) just like my mother! - We will all do this at some point, denial will just make it worse.
  • I will NEVER start a blog!
  • I will NEVER live outside the south or far away from family! - If you know me this is a big thing.
I can now say this:
  • I am THANKFUL for the Lord’s grace poured out lavishly on our lives!
  • I am THANKFUL for the hard and dark places He has brought me, so that I may look upward at the cross.
  • I am THANKFUL for when I said ‘never’ that God said, “Yes you can, trust me, I am here”
  • I homeschool, I do things like my mother, I started a blog, and we moved out of the south 1,000 miles away from where I grew up.
I started this blog so that whoever wants to can follow along and hear about God’s faithfulness in our lives and receive updates on our Ethiopian adoption. I would love to share with you how our lives are changed from the gospel on a daily basis, about our children and how God is already working in their hearts! I have deep southern roots and God has planted us in New Jersey, what a culture shock! I pray that this blog will point only to Christ. Join me as we pray, laugh, and cry through life together!

Never is a word I’ve used often and should now realize that I should never say never! Here are some favorite 'nevers' that I have said before:

  • I will NEVER homeschool my children! - I’m now a homeschool mom of 4 years.
  • I will NEVER (fill in the blank) just like my mother! - We will all do this at some point, denial will just make it worse.
  • I will NEVER start a blog!
  • I will NEVER live outside the south or far away from family! - If you know me this is a big thing.

I can now say this:

  • I am THANKFUL for the Lord’s grace poured out lavishly on our lives!
  • I am THANKFUL for the hard and dark places He has brought me, so that I may look upward at the cross.
  • I am THANKFUL for when I said ‘never’ that God said, “Yes you can, trust me, I am here”
  • I homeschool, I do things like my mother, I started a blog, and we moved out of the south 1,000 miles away from where I grew up.

I started this blog so that whoever wants to can follow along and hear about God’s faithfulness in our lives and receive updates on our Ethiopian adoption. I would love to share with you how our lives are changed from the gospel on a daily basis, about our children and how God is already working in their hearts! I have deep southern roots and God has planted us in New Jersey, what a culture shock!

I pray that this blog will point only to Christ. Join me as we pray, laugh, and cry
through life together!

posts.title: Clearances
posts.html:
We got back all of our clearances!! It took longer than we thought, but that's ok. All in God's timing. We are resting in His peace that He has a perfect plan. We are finished with our homestudy and are waiting for the final draft in the mail! We can now start gathering our documents for our Dossier. This past month has been long, busy and hard, but thankful for the promises that I'm not alone! As I sit here, all that comes to mind is praise to our Father, for His faithfulness and protection over and over again these past few weeks.

Lamentations 3:22-24 The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; his mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness. "The Lord is my portion," says my soul, "therefore I will hope in Him."

posts.title: More Paperwork
posts.markdown:
We received our homestudy and sent off our I-600a. We are now just waiting on our fingerprint appointment. We are gathering more paperwork to make up our dossier and then it will bounce around to all the different places before going to Ethiopia.

I took a break with my mom and sister for a long weekend in Cape Cod. God's timing is perfect. I needed some time to just breath. I didn't have anywhere to be (except for whale watching), I soaked up the quiet, had good food and conversation. I welcomed the break especially after our 6 crazy weeks which I will get to soon. I will post pictures and fill in more later. For now, I'm thankful for this next step in the process and praying it goes smoothly and quickly so that our papers can be on the way to Ethiopia soon!

I will post pictures and fill in more later. For now, I'm thankful for this next step in the process and praying it goes smoothly and quickly so that our papers can be on the way to Ethiopia soon!

posts.title: April showers bring May flowers
posts.html:
I'm gonna back up a few weeks to when they told me our clearances were in and they were working on our rough draft for our homestudy. It was in the middle of some hard weeks at our house. I have to go back a few weeks before that, to the longest winter I have EVER known. I can tell you it's been hard. Even New Jersey guys are saying this year was hard. So, it's not just this southern girl. Everybody was ready for April. So, our family makes it through the winter without any major sickness. Then here comes April right around the corner and we could feel the tension building as we were able to actually get outside and play since oh, October? without being cold and miserable.

Three out of four kids come down with the stomach bug at the end of March. Then as we are getting somewhat back into routine, some family came to visit and from that visit we end up w/ our youngest in the ER with bad croup, having breathing treatments and the youngest 3 with 103 fevers. As that week closes and we are trying to recover from lots of holding and watching movies, which means nothing got "done" around the house which may or may not have gotten accomplished without sickness! We then have a weekend of catch up on laundry and some cleaning and try to get prepared for a new week. Then that Monday night our oldest complains of stomach pains, where her appendix is located. I then spend all night watching her while she tries to rest, only to go the Dr and confirm what I already knew; appendicitis. So, we head to the ER, just one week after being in the ER with our youngest, to confirm with machines that indeed it is appendicitis. After an emergency appendectomy and a week of her watching movies, helping her walk everywhere and normal mealtimes and play times with the other kids,  I was ready for a quiet weekend. So, we headed into another week when our sweet 10 year old German Sheppard started acting weird. She started limping and not eating. We then start another week and I'm taking care of a dieing dog, and 4 kids who are now ready to get outside and play because the weather is beautiful! We ended up having to put our dog down. I can't stop to think about it too long, because it's still sad. I miss her already. She had been with us almost our whole marriage. She welcomed home 4 out of 5 kids and moved across the country with us! She was kinda like a "nana" dog from Peter Pan. Always checking on the kids and was always there at the end of long days to sit by me. She comforted me in some of my darkest days and for that I'm grateful. I was never an indoor dog person until I met my husband and over the years I've come to appreciate it.

 

So, after 6 weeks of crazy later I'm emotionally and physically drained. I'm now looking at the end of another weekend and looking into the beginning of a new week and month with hope that only comes from the Lord. The Lord's timing is perfect. It still blows me away with such small details in my life. I was able to go away the first weekend in May with my mom and sister for a long girls weekend before my sister gets married. It was right after these crazy 6 weeks and perfect timing with my husband work. I couldn't have picked a better weekend. We almost went over Memorial Day weekend but nothing was working out. I can only point to the Lord for hand picking the weekend that I needed. Thank you Lord for your faithfulness! I will share more about our girls weekend soon!

posts.title: Fingerprints, Again
posts.markdown: We just did our 2nd set of fingerprints and are waiting for them to come back. As soon as get the clearances our dossier can be sent out to get authenticated and sent to Ethiopia!! So, we are almost there. Keep praying as we come to the end of the final stretch of paperwork. We are ready to be "paper ready" so we can receive a referral. It is still going to be a long wait and I will need prayer. I know God has a plan, it's just hard to be waiting. Thankful He isn't surprised by "longer wait times than what we thought" and "delays". Today, I'm praying for patience in the waiting and peace knowing He has us in His hands. I'm also praying for our children as they are asking more frequently when they will get to meet their brothers. Thankful for His leading in our family.
posts.html: We just did our 2nd set of fingerprints and are waiting for them to come back. As soon as get the clearances our dossier can be sent out to get authenticated and sent to Ethiopia!! So, we are almost there. Keep praying as we come to the end of the final stretch of paperwork. We are ready to be "paper ready" so we can receive a referral. It is still going to be a long wait and I will need prayer. I know God has a plan, it's just hard to be waiting. Thankful He isn't surprised by "longer wait times than what we thought" and "delays". Today, I'm praying for patience in the waiting and peace knowing He has us in His hands. I'm also praying for our children as they are asking more frequently when they will get to meet their brothers. Thankful for His leading in our family.

posts.title: Dossier
posts.html:
We finished our dossier!! Such a big milestone in this process. We sent our dossier on to our agency on June 14th. The only things we had left was to have a zero balance before they could send the dossier on to the next stop and to receive our fingerprint approval.

 

We decided to go out of town for a quick father's day weekend. It was amazing, to just relax and have fun spending time together.

 

 

We got back and we had received our fingerprint approval in the mail!! So, the only thing left was the money. We know this is what God has called us to do as a family, but it's hard to wait and think I've done all this work just to have it sit, waiting to go to Ethiopia because of money! Then my sweet husband reminds me that "it's not our timing but His". Thankful for the reminder to fix my eyes on the one who has called us to this journey and remember that He has a perfect plan.

One of the Bible verses we do with the kids is Proverbs 3:5 "Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding." It's such a "simple" one that we teach it to our kids, yet, as an adult I'm having a hard time remembering. I can't do this on my own strength, I can't try to "understand" that "my timeline" isn't going like I thought it would be. I have to remember and tell myself almost daily that His plan and timing is perfect, not mine. So, all that to say, we found out on a Monday that we were good to send off the dossier as long as we payed the balance.

So we prayed and I had a give it all up to Jesus/cry it out Tuesday night. I had a peace wash over me and I knew it's going to be ok.

This is where there is no way I can point to anyone but the Lord. I woke up Wednesday morning, yes just 2 days later, with someone who called me and said "I've been praying for a while about what to give. I'm coming back to the same numbers, between this amount and this amount. I'm just not sure so I wanted to find out if there was anything that needed to be payed right now and how much is left with this first section of payments." I can't even tell you how I felt. I sat there thinking, is this for real?! I said what amount was left and this person said "well, that answers my question it was right in the middle of those numbers" I'm still wrapping my brain around it.

So, we were able to pay off our balance, our agency sent our dossier out for translation and authentication June 24th!!

We are now waiting as it bounces around to different places and then it will be on it's way to Ethiopia!! We will keep our eyes on Him and keep praying for our child/children and Ethiopia as we wait...

posts.title: The List
posts.markdown:
Our dossier finally made it's way to Ethiopia!

I can honestly say that now that it's there I had a peace wash over me. The last 6 months have been paperwork, interviews and phone calls, tears and lots of prayers. Now, the next part of our journey starts.

The wait.

I'm not sure how long this will be for us and our family. For now, I'm resting in the peace that only comes from the Father.

Thank you Lord for your peace that surpasses all understanding.
posts.html:
Our dossier finally made it's way to Ethiopia!

I can honestly say that now that it's there I had a peace wash over me. The last 6 months have been paperwork, interviews and phone calls, tears and lots of prayers. Now, the next part of our journey starts.

The wait.

I'm not sure how long this will be for us and our family. For now, I'm resting in the peace that only comes from the Father.

Thank you Lord for your peace that surpasses all understanding.

posts.title: Delays
posts.markdown:
Y'all, This is such an up and down emotional journey it's hard to put into words.

I wanted to share what happened in the weeks between sending off our dossier and when it actually landed.

Our dossier got sent off on June 24th. The time frame is typically 4 weeks. So, I was excited to see how it was bouncing around to all the places getting translated and authenticated.

To make a long story short, it took an extra trip back to D.C. (one of the stops along the way) which isn't what it's suppose to do. I thought, oh maybe it's stopping there before getting to Ethiopia. Wrong. There was a document not done correctly. It was found, fixed, and back in the process.

It doesn't sound like a big deal. "What's 3 more weeks?" A lot in the adoption world. You don't get on "the list" until your dossier is in country. So, instead of getting there when I expected it was delayed.

Thankfully God was not surprised. I struggled big time. I thought "we were suppose to be on the list already!". I cried and couldn't believe it. As I again had to lay it all out before the Lord, I saw my heart. I know the answers, I know God's timing is perfect, but in the raw moments I saw how when things don't go my way it can be ugly.

Then as I cry out to Him in my unfaithfulness to trust Him, He is faithful.

I was then reminded and encouraged by another adoptive mama. " You watched God's hand place y'alls family exactly where he wants you on the list to receive the exact child or children that are meant for your family."

He is faithful.

He is faithful.

posts.title: Cape Cod
posts.markdown:
I was able to get away with my mom and sister without children. We haven't done a girls trip since the summer of 2002 right before I got married.

So this was a much needed break.

My sister is getting married in the fall back in sweet home Alabama. We wanted a quiet weekend somewhere we haven't been. So, Cape Cod here we come!!

We left Jersey and made our way up the coast.
posts.html:
I was able to get away with my mom and sister without children. We haven't done a girls trip since the summer of 2002 right before I got married.

So this was a much needed break.

My sister is getting married in the fall back in sweet home Alabama. We wanted a quiet weekend somewhere we haven't been. So, Cape Cod here we come!!

We left Jersey and made our way up the coast.

posts.title: Peace
posts.markdown:
I'm thankful for the Lord's peace that passes all understanding.

I prayed that he would take this process and allow me to just keep on with daily life or I would be a crazy person. He has y'all, He has.

I had a number laid on my heart for months before we turned in our dossier and while we were in the thick of it. I prayed about it and I knew that it was going to be our number. When we received our first number, it was our number.

His faithfulness still amazes me.

Our paperwork landed in Ethiopia later than I thought. 2 months into waiting I can see God's guiding hand. At the time I didn't understand why it was taking so long and it was hard.  I do know that ever since our paperwork landed I have had such a peace about it.  Y'all that is ONLY from the Lord.
I will say that for half the month of August and almost all of September we were in Alabama. My sister got married.  We extended our stay for a family vacation at the beach and also to see family back home. I also went to the Unfailing Love retreat for adoptive and foster mamas. It was so good to be around women who get it. I'm just thankful for the first 2 months on the list to be full of love and family.

I'm sure when winter settles in up here in Jersey and I'm not sitting on the beach soaking in all of God's creation or surrounded by family my thoughts will linger and ask "how much longer do we have to wait?". I'm sure there will be days that I long for Africa, even though I haven't been there yet, because there isn't a "due date" for me to look forward too.

For now though, I'm resting in His peace. I'm trusting in His plan and timing.

posts.title: Family Update
posts.markdown:
We wanted to share what all is going on in our life and I can't think of a better weekend or month to share it than November! This is Orphan Sunday and November is adoption awareness month. God is so good and faithful! The biggest thing going on in our life right now is that we are adopting from Ethiopia!! We started praying more about this almost 2 years ago when God laid it more heavily on our hearts. We kept seeking God's guidance on when to turn in papers and we officially turned in our papers in the middle of December last year. If you want to read about why I started a blog go here. We are now in the middle of waiting on a referral. It can be months or years, we don't know. What we do know is that we are required to make 2 trips to Ethiopia. The first trip is to meet our child/children and finalize paperwork in court. The second trip is to bring our child/children home! We have had people ask how they can help?? Please pray! Pray for our family as we prepare our hearts and home for more children. Pray for our child and or children in Ethiopia, for protection and for their hearts. Pray for protection as we travel to Ethiopia.   The next thing I wanted to share about is our puzzle fundraiser. We have a 1,000 piece puzzle of an Ethiopian landscape (see picture below), and are asking that each piece be sponsored for $5/piece. We will write the donors name and/or family name on the back of the piece, and when the puzzle is completed we will hang it up in a double sided frame. Our child/children will know who helped bring them home. We are praying that we will raise $5,000 that will go directly towards our travel to Ethiopia. If you feel led, and you want to help by sponsoring a puzzle piece, please click the "donate" button on the side. ![](/content/images/2014/May/DSC_0048-2.jpg)

our puzzle

1 John 3:16-18 states, " By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers. But if anyone has the world's goods and sees his brother in need, yet closes his heart against him, how does God's love abide in him? Little children, let us not love in word or talk but in deed and in truth."  We have chosen these verses as our mission statement, because they serve as a daily reminder for us to live out the Gospel through our time, resources, and actions.

Thank you for all the ways you are supporting our family!!

Love E & B
posts.html:
We wanted to share what all is going on in our life and I can't think of a better weekend or month to share it than November! This is Orphan Sunday and November is adoption awareness month. God is so good and faithful!

The biggest thing going on in our life right now is that we are adopting from Ethiopia!!

We started praying more about this almost 2 years ago when God laid it more heavily on our hearts. We kept seeking God's guidance on when to turn in papers and we officially turned in our papers in the middle of December last year. If you want to read about why I started a blog go here.

We are now in the middle of waiting on a referral. It can be months or years, we don't know. What we do know is that we are required to make 2 trips to Ethiopia. The first trip is to meet our child/children and finalize paperwork in court. The second trip is to bring our child/children home!

We have had people ask how they can help??

Please pray! Pray for our family as we prepare our hearts and home for more children. Pray for our child and or children in Ethiopia, for protection and for their hearts. Pray for protection as we travel to Ethiopia.

  The next thing I wanted to share about is our puzzle fundraiser. We have a 1,000 piece puzzle of an Ethiopian landscape (see picture below), and are asking that each piece be sponsored for $5/piece. We will write the donors name and/or family name on the back of the piece, and when the puzzle is completed we will hang it up in a double sided frame. Our child/children will know who helped bring them home. We are praying that we will raise $5,000 that will go directly towards our travel to Ethiopia. If you feel led, and you want to help by sponsoring a puzzle piece, please click the "donate" button on the side.

our puzzle

1 John 3:16-18 states, " By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers. But if anyone has the world's goods and sees his brother in need, yet closes his heart against him, how does God's love abide in him? Little children, let us not love in word or talk but in deed and in truth."  We have chosen these verses as our mission statement, because they serve as a daily reminder for us to live out the Gospel through our time, resources, and actions.

Thank you for all the ways you are supporting our family!!

Love E & B

posts.title: Puzzle Piece Update
posts.markdown: We wanted to thank everyone who has donated to our puzzle! It means so much to us that you want to help us bring our child/children home. So, thank you so much. If you are just now hearing about this than you can go here to read about our puzzle fundraiser for our adoption as well as what all is going on in our life.  If you feel led you can "sponsor" a piece of the puzzle and your name will go on the back. ![](/content/images/2014/May/DSC_0048-2.jpg) Thanks again to all the families and individual people who have sponsored a piece. love B & E
posts.html:
We wanted to thank everyone who has donated to our puzzle! It means so much to us that you want to help us bring our child/children home. So, thank you so much.

If you are just now hearing about this than you can go here to read about our puzzle fundraiser for our adoption as well as what all is going on in our life.  If you feel led you can "sponsor" a piece of the puzzle and your name will go on the back.

Thanks again to all the families and individual people who have sponsored a piece.

love

B & E

posts.title: Praying together
posts.markdown:
I wanted to ask you to join us today, January 25th, as we pray for Ethiopia. We are joining other families and individuals at 11:30 (CST) to pray specifically for Ethiopia, international adoption, and our family. We are praying for:
  • the government officials who make decisions to see the need for children to be in families not orphanages
  • the children's hearts who are waiting for a family, that they would know they are loved
  • for peace in God's timing for the families who are waiting
If you would like to read another families journey, they shared some specific things to pray for here. Thanks for joining us in our journey. B & E
posts.html:
I wanted to ask you to join us today, January 25th, as we pray for Ethiopia. We are joining other families and individuals at 11:30 (CST) to pray specifically for Ethiopia, international adoption, and our family.

We are praying for:

  • the government officials who make decisions to see the need for children to be in families not orphanages
  • the children's hearts who are waiting for a family, that they would know they are loved
  • for peace in God's timing for the families who are waiting

If you would like to read another families journey, they shared some specific things to pray for here.

Thanks for joining us in our journey.

B & E

posts.title: HIV (RED)
posts.html:
Today, U2 is giving a free download on iTunes, of their song "Invisible" to raise awareness of HIV/AIDS to benefit (RED). The Bank of America is joining (RED) in the fight to deliver an AIDS free generation. For every download of the song "Invisible", Bank of America is donating $1 to (RED). For more information about this project visit (RED).

 

If you are interested in learning more about HIV Project Hopeful is a good source of information

 

Share this post and spread the word!

E

posts.title: Winter Wonderland?
posts.markdown:
I prepared myself for the winter months by spending time in the South during the Fall. Yet, nothing can prepare you for week, after week of snow. Just when you think you are getting a break another possible winter storm is on the horizon. I'm not gonna lie, this winter has been hard. I'm here to say that no matter how much I soak it up while I'm home, it's hard to find joy in the winter up here in the North. 

The sky's are grey, the temperature is cold and we have been inside for weeks. Yes, my southern mamas, weeks.

I've found sweet moments of reading my Bible early in the gray mornings and it lifts my spirit. I hold on the promise that the Lord has us exactly where He wants us. He is teaching me to be content and joyful.


What does the Bible say about being content & joyful?

What does the Bible say about being content & joyful?

posts.title: Movement
posts.markdown:
I've been quiet for a few months, so please forgive me. The past few months have been hard. There has been little movement of referrals in Ethiopia. There was a big meeting a few weeks ago that we have all been waiting to hear the outcome.

Ethiopia finally made a decision on how international adoptions will proceed. They are now wanting all children to be up for local adoption for 2 months before being eligible for international adoption.

We all rejoiced that there was an answer to all the investigations and waiting. Yet, there was another 2 more months of children waiting for their forever families, and families waiting for their children. My heart breaks knowing that there are children waiting.

As Palm Sunday approached I was a weeping mess.  I cried at everything. My heart that has been forever changed. Waiting. Motherhood that is sanctifying me daily. Our road of grief. Hope. Praying for Ethiopia. The weight of my sin that Jesus carried to the cross was heavy.

After crying it out all week long I was ready for Easter.

Then the Hope of Christ filled my spirit up and I was renewed as I went into Easter weekend with our family. Thankful that I could leave the heaviness with Him. Thankful that His plans are better than our plans. His timing is perfect.

So, after weeks of heaviness and lots of prayers and tears later we actually hear good news!

Our agency heard from the Regional Government that they would only apply this new step in the process to those children who haven't received regional approval. This means that the children who have already received Regional Government approval, can move forward and be referred for international adoption! 

Please keep praying for Ethiopia, the children and the government as they make decisions. 

E
posts.html:
I've been quiet for a few months, so please forgive me. The past few months have been hard. There has been little movement of referrals in Ethiopia. There was a big meeting a few weeks ago that we have all been waiting to hear the outcome.

Ethiopia finally made a decision on how international adoptions will proceed. They are now wanting all children to be up for local adoption for 2 months before being eligible for international adoption.

We all rejoiced that there was an answer to all the investigations and waiting. Yet, there was another 2 more months of children waiting for their forever families, and families waiting for their children. My heart breaks knowing that there are children waiting.

As Palm Sunday approached I was a weeping mess. I cried at everything. My heart that has been forever changed. Waiting. Motherhood that is sanctifying me daily. Our road of grief. Hope. Praying for Ethiopia. The weight of my sin that Jesus carried to the cross was heavy.

After crying it out all week long I was ready for Easter.

Then the Hope of Christ filled my spirit up and I was renewed as I went into Easter weekend with our family. Thankful that I could leave the heaviness with Him. Thankful that His plans are better than our plans. His timing is perfect.

So, after weeks of heaviness and lots of prayers and tears later we actually hear good news!

Our agency heard from the Regional Government that they would only apply this new step in the process to those children who haven't received regional approval. This means that the children who have already received Regional Government approval, can move forward and be referred for international adoption!

Please keep praying for Ethiopia, the children and the government as they make decisions.

E

posts.title: Puzzle Update
posts.markdown:
I first want to apologize for not getting more updates out about our puzzle fundraiser. We want to thank everyone who has come along side us in prayer as well as donated to our adoption! We are still doing a puzzle fundrasier to help bring our child(ren) home. So far we have 149 pieces sold which is $745. THANK YOU SO MUCH! We have a 1,000 piece puzzle of an Ethiopian landscape (see picture below). We will write the donors name and/or family name on the back of the piece, and when the puzzle is completed we will hang it up in a double sided frame. Our child/children will know who helped bring them home. ![](/content/images/2014/May/DSC_0048-2.jpg)

our puzzle

posts.title: About Us
posts.markdown: ![](/content/images/2014/May/IMG_6255-2-2.jpg) I’m Elizabeth, and I married my high school sweetheart, Mr. B. We have been married for 12 years, have 4 children at home and I homeschool. I grew up in the south and all that entails; sweet tea, hot summers, beach, BBQ (which I crave), drawn out accents, college football (SEC), saying: y’all, bless her heart, and sugar. I never wanted to leave. The Lord had other plans. He has brought us out of our comfort zones and into New Jersey! In here you will find our journey through adoption. You will see the chaos and struggle of life that rely on Jesus daily. You will hear my heart on homeschooling, adoption, being a wife and mother, but mostly I want to share what God is doing in our life. If you want to help us bring our kids home you can read about our puzzle fundraiser [here](/myer-family-update).

If you want to help us bring our kids home you can read about our puzzle fundraiser here.

posts.title: 11 months
posts.markdown:
11 months of officially waiting for our children. It's hard to wrap my head around an unknown wait because at this point in a preganancy we would have had a baby.  

Then, as I work through our wait, my heart aches as I think of the children that are waiting, alone and wondering if they will belong to a family again. It keeps me up at night as I pray for them. 

I also pray that more families would answer with a "yes!". Even if it looks messy. When we obey God's commandments to care for the least of these, our hearts and lives are forever changed. 

This will look different for everyone, but the answer is still the same. "yes". It seems simple but it's giving up your life and the life you thought you would have and surrendering it all to the One who paid it with His blood. 

So, I cling to the promises that He is faithful to finish the work He started. 

Are you saying "yes"?

posts.title: Bind My Wandering Heart To Thee
posts.markdown:
O to grace how great a debtor
Daily I’m constrained to be!
Let Thy goodness, like a fetter,

Bind my wandering heart to Thee.

Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it,
Prone to leave the God I love;
Here’s my heart, O take and seal it,
Seal it for Thy courts above.

God has been nudging me lately with this song as well as with Titus 2. His timing is so perfect. He is telling me I need to make Him my priority. It's not: extra sleep in the morning skipping my only still moments sitting at His feet, Facebook or Instagram, blogging/reading blogs etc. The list could keep going and is going to look different for everyone.  

No, I don't have to get all the things done in one day. But, I do have to keep my eyes on Him, point my children to Christ and pray for the strength for today. 

Moms who are tired, don't know what to do next because there are too many things on the list and not enough time in the day and can't seem to stay on top of the laundry... I'm with you.

posts.title: Noonday Ambassador
posts.markdown:
I want to share a little bit about Noonday Collection. It's an amazing company that uses fashion & design to create economic opportunity for the vulnerable. 
They partner with artisans around the world to create a marketplace so they can provide food and education for their families while working and earning living wages. 

I'm so excited to share with you that I have become a Noonday Ambassador! 

I'm so excited to link arms with the artisans and other ambassadors to share the artisans stories and help bring awareness to the power of our purchases! 

If you want to learn more about Noonday and how you can help go to [my Noonday page.](http://elizabethmyer.noondaycollection.com)

posts.title: Noonday Collection
posts.markdown:
Welcome to my Noonday page. I’m Elizabeth Myer and I married my high school sweetheart, Mr. B. We have been married for 12 years and have 4 children at home. We are a southern family transplanted to New Jersey! I first heard about Noonday through an adoption blog. I fell in love with what they do as well as the jewelry. I can't wait to share the artisans stories and how our purchases can make a difference. I'm so excited to be an ambassador to help bring education and awareness to New Jersey. I would love to hear from you! Let me know if you want to host a trunk show or if you know someone who is adopting and how Noonday can help! Feel free to email me [elizabeth.noonday@gmail.com](mailto:elizabeth.noonday@gmail.com?subject=Interested in Noonday)
or check out [my Noonday page](http://elizabethmyer.noondaycollection.com/)

posts.title: mama
posts.markdown:
This is something that has been on my heart for a while. After talking with another mom I was encouraged to share from my heart.  
There are blogs out there saying how 

 

There is so much I want to tell you, but it won't come across right on a blog. I wish I could sit down on a couch and drink coffee or tea with you as we share our struggles. 

Your struggles are real, and your feelings are validated here. 

It's hard to get up every morning and do the same.thing.every.day. It doesn't matter if you stay at home, work full time or part time, motherhood is hard and challenging and sometimes brings out the not so pretty us.  

When I had my first almost 12 years ago, things were different. The judging and questioning your every decsion by people who think they know what's best for YOUR child wasn't as strong then as it is today. I think it's due to social media that is constantly in the way. The lines are blurred in what is public and private. We believe everyone else's story that's been photoshopped, tweaked and perfected to best show off what you want people to think your life is, as reality. It's not. 

Where are the crumbs on the ground? The laundry still in the basket on the floor (or still in the wash from the day before)?

I still had the sweet old lady in the grocery store tell me "cherish every moment becuase it goes by fast" and it was always when I had been up what seemed like for weeks with a teething baby and "cherising every moment" seemed a little crazy. 

My mother was an encouragment to me and maybe that's why I didn't listen to outside noise as much? She told me from the beginning "they will only be little for a little while, the dirt will always be there". Sometimes I would hold onto that a little too much and not get ANYTHING "done", well except take care of another person which is a big accomplishment in my book. 

The benefits in social media today means that we can connect easier than 10 years ago.  
The difference I see today from 10 years ago is believing the picture perfect Instagram world.   

The noise and chatter of what you should be doing, how it should look and "Oh you don't do _____ this way?" are pulling you into a million different directions. 

I want to encourage you to tune it out. Listen to your heart and turn to the Lord who is the only voice we should be listening to. 

I'm not saying don't listen to other mamas, we NEED older moms who have walked this road and come out on the other side and can open their arms as they help guide us. I'm saying stop listening to the noise of distractions that we have today.

You are the perfect mom for the child God has given you. He made your child for you. Rest in that. 
If you believe what God's word says, that children are a blessing, train up your child in the way he should go, be thankful in all things, hold on to that as you go about your day. He will provide grace and wisdom if you only sit and be still.  

Our worship to Him in this season of raising babies is a beautiful mess that comes with unending laundry, dishes, late nights with a crying baby, lots of poop, but also hugs and kisses and sweet moments that you etch in your brain so you won't forget them. Is it hard? yes! Are there days I feel I can't do one more thing? yes! I'm in the trenches with you, just a little ahead of some and I'm looking back on those precious days with little ones with teary eyes.

Keep your eyes on the Lord and what His call is on your life. 


So, I'm linking arms with you mamas. Don't let the world tell you are not enough or don't do enough. 

Hang in there mama with little babies who aren't sleeping through the night, I promise you will get to sleep and take a shower on a regular basis again. 

love 
E

posts.title: Noonday Giveaway!
posts.markdown:
If you are reading this because of the Noonday blog train/giveaway, welcome! This is my first giveaway and I don't think I could be more excited! I love Noonday and all that it represents. If you don't know what Noonday is, read about it [here](http://elizabethmyer.noondaycollection.com/our-story-our-impact.html). I became an [ambassador](http://indeedandintruth.com/noonday-ambassador/) a few months ago and I'm so excited about sharing the artisan stories with y'all.

This giveaway snuck up on me and I had so much that I wanted to say. The artisans stories encourage me to be bold and share. Today we are celebrating our youngest 3rd birthday. I think of the women as they are holding thier babies and are able to provide for them through the work of Noonday. We all have the same dreams for our kids. The group that has a special place in my heart is from Ethiopia. They are women who many of them have been isolated from their families because they have HIV. I want to share [Tigiest's](http://vimeo.com/89689291#t=0s) story with you. I hope you watch and hear her words about how Noonday has helped her provide for her children. 

<iframe src="//player.vimeo.com/video/89689291?title=0&byline=0&portrait=0&color=34495e" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>



So, what better way to celebrate women keeping their children with them than a fun giveaway! 

The new Fall line is [here](http://elizabethmyer.noondaycollection.com/)! There are so many beautiful pieces and stories. Check it out and see which piece is your favorite.

Leave a comment with your favorite piece and favorite artisan story and you will be entered to win a $50 gift card! The giveaway will end next Monday night, September 1st and I will announce the winner on September 2nd. 

I hope you find encouragement from the stories and share about the impact that our purchases can have.

As women I hope we will stand up with other women and make our voices heard that we do have power in our purchase! I want y'all to head over to [Amanda Collin's](http://openingourheartsandtrusting.blogspot.com/2014/08/fall-styling-tips-and-my-first-ever.html) giveaway, and be sure to check out [Holly Shore](http://integrativemom.com/giveaways/noonday/) and [Baylor Knott's](http://www.heritagefromthelord.blogspot.com/) tomorrow!!  


Love 
E

**UPDATE** the comment section isn't working and we are fixing it, until then email me (elizabeth.noonday@gmail.com) to be entered! Thanks!

posts.title: Fair Trade
posts.markdown:
Every month there is always some sort of awareness. October is used to share about Fair Trade. 

I'm so excited to share that Noonday Collection joined the Fair Trade Federation! 

What are the principles of Fair Trade? 

The Fair Trade Federation Principles are designed to promote greater equity in international trade.  Fair Trade is a strategy for poverty alleviation and sustainable development. FTF members fully commit to the following principles in all of their transactions:

    Create Opportunities for Economically and Socially Marginalized Producers
    Develop Transparent and Accountable Relationships
    Build Capacity
    Promote Fair Trade
    Pay Promptly and Fairly
    Support Safe and Empowering Working Conditions
    Ensure the Rights of Children
    Cultivate Environmental Stewardship
    Respect Cultural Identity
 To learn more about Fair Trade go [here](http://www.noondaycollection.com/blog-1/noonday-collection-joins-the-fair-trade-federation#sthash.KNjhBE8C.dpuf)

Respect Cultural Identity

To learn more about Fair Trade go here

posts.title: January
posts.markdown:
Hey y'all! I haven't shared about our adoption or life in a while and there is a lot to say. First, God is good, ALL the time. 
Yes, even in the wait, in the unknown, in the lonely and when you are standing on the mountain after coming through a trial, even when you bury someone you love. 

God is good. 
He is enough. 

I've had to remind myself of that lately and sometimes it's said through tears. 

This month brings in a new year and prayers that our child/children will be home with us soon! 

This month is also a reminder of the loss of my grandfather, Papa. He was joyful.

posts.title: New Year and Puzzle Update!
posts.markdown:
Hey y'all! I wanted to thank you all again for your prayers for us and reaching out and asking us what is going on with our adoption. It means so much to us that you remember and ask and want to hear the latest. It's been 17 months since we were officially placed on "the list" We are still waiting... In the meantime I'm making a promise that I will update more often on our life up here in the North. I'm also going to update on our Puzzle: First, We want to thank everyone who has come along side us in prayer as well as donated to our adoption! Second, we have sold 175 pieces which is $875 towards bringing our child/children home! We have a 1,000 piece puzzle of an Ethiopian landscape (see picture below). We will write the donors name and/or family name on the back of the piece, and when the puzzle is completed we will hang it up in a double sided frame. Our child/children will know who helped bring them home. ![](/content/images/2014/May/DSC_0048-2.jpg)

our puzzle
